#Text=Tony Blair speaks in Canada
#Text=Saturday , October 27 , 2007

#Text=Tony Blair , United Kingdom 's former Prime Minister , made his first public appearance since stepping down as PM yesterday at a speech entitled Global Relations : A Conversation with Tony Blair to an audience of about 2,400 in Calgary , Alberta from noon to 2:30 p.m. in the Telus Convention Centre , sponsored by Toronto-Dominion Bank ( TD Canada Trust ) .
#Text=Lunch was served with an authentic Alberta beef steak .
#Text=Alberta premier Ed Stelmach , Calgary mayor Dave Bronconnier , and other public officials were there .
#Text=" Congratulations on winning a third term .

#Text= If we want to win , we ca n't just be for democracy and freedom .

column1: #Text=" If we 're going to fight this terrorism off , we 're going to have to show them we 're as tough as they are ... and stay the course . "
#Text=Blair said even though it 'll be a long-road in the war it 's important to not give up the fight against " the forces of extremism . "

column1: #Text=Blair is an Envoy in the Quartet on the Middle East , which is involved in mediating the peace process in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict .
#Text=He become Envoy the same day he stepped down as PM .
#Text=" This morning I looked at your local papers and saw ' Premier Under Fire ' .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=He also commented about Alberta 's oil and gas royalty dispute saying ,  I 'm just glad it 's not my decision , " and after three terms of being PM he 's " learned when to keep my mouth shut . "

column1: #Text=Alberta has the second largest oil reserves in the world and Abu Dhabi National Energy Co. recently made their third offer for $5-billion to buy Alberta-based company Prime West Energy Trust .
#Text=In relation to that , Blair said , " Calgary is not only the new centre of Canada or North America , but a global centre for the world . "
#Text=" I often say to people , Canada will become one of the most powerful nations in the world . "
#Text=He also pointed out , " As power grows ... so does more responsibility .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= Optimism is something you get very easily when you come to Canada , " he said relating to Canada 's strong alliances with other countries .

column1: #Text=He said Canada has a " can-do " attitude .
#Text=After , he sat down with former premier of New Brunswick Frank McKenna , now TD Bank 's deputy chairman , in green armchairs , part of TD 's advertising campaign , and had a Q&A period .
#Text=Journalists were not allowed to use cameras or recording devices during the event as ordered by Scotland Yard , the Globe and Mail reports , who were told by event organisers .
#Text=Blair also praised Canada 's wine , " This is a secret you 've just got to get out . "
